result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Chad Hoaglan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Darrell Chad Hoaglan in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense request defendant's appearance waived. Court waives defendant's appearance. Defense request plea and sentencing hearing. State does not object. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to Br. 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Darrell Chad Hoaglan not in court, in custody.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense counsel requested a status conference date.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darrell Chad Hoaglan in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Darrell Chad Hoaglan in custody.  Mark Patrick Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk;  BN  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
